data.name: UBOAT: The Silent Wolf
data.description:
Immerse yourself in the epic world of UBOAT: The Silent Wolf and take on the role of a commander of a legendary World War II submarine. Experience an incredible story in the singleplayer STORY CAMPAIGN or lead a group of four friends in the COOPERATIVE MODE. Together, track down enemies to achieve success on the maritime battlefield and demonstrate the vessel's power!

Engage in thrilling battles with rival vessels. Keep a vigilant eye through the periscope, set up ambushes and watch out for enemy aircrafts.

Feel the true essence of being on board a submarine. Encounter the hardship and dangers that crews had to confront during the monumental global conflict.

Use your skills and dive into the deep waters of FREE ROAM mode. Explore an uncharted world filled with mysterious locations and captivating adventures. Confront enemies, explore the vast waters and enjoy the freedom of navigating the open sea.

Main features of the game:
- story campaign and cooperative mode for up to four players,
- open world full of dangers and challenges in free roam mode,
- advanced control system for the submarine,
- extensive combat system, faithfully recreated ship and aircraft models,
- a variety of additional activities and mini games.

changelog.change_log:
New content
- Added new item tools for role-playing
- Added two story missions for free roam
- Implemented a feature to mark servers as casual/hardcore

Changes

Single player:

- Visual improvements in enemy ports
- Adjusted the difficulty balance of enemy ports
- Improved enemy AI
- Visual adjustments in the damage system
- Fixed an issue with raised gangway after loading a game save
- Fixed an issue with a missing switch for manual steer after loading a game save

Multiplayer:

- Shortened the length of the code in multiplayer mode to 5 digits
- Fixed the player list available in the pause menu and improved the kick and ban system
- Resolved issues with inability to join private sessions
- Fixed a typo on the note with regions
- Numerous server system corrections
- Activated game version control for multiplayer mode

- improved detection of convoys by hydrophone 
- water noise muting in the hydrophone
- improved detection of our boat by opponents 
- Improved the accuracy of the opponents during high acceleration of the game time 
- improved parameters for the automatic release of objects
- improved the grip of objects when moving around the boat 
- changed the resolution scaling parameters in the game engine 
- added content to credits list
- added more level of detail of objects on the boat
- added collisions on objects in Avatar Shop 
- added an security feature to multiplayer - a six-digit code
- corrected display of texts in the main menu�


- fixed problems with VoIP, players should always be able to hear each other when joining a server 
- fixed bug in the ability to invite other players to play together via oculus systems 
- fixed a bug with the incorrect display of the player list in the multiplayer settings tab of the server during multiplayer play 
- fixed a bug causing opponents in random convoys not to spawn after using FTM

Ahoy Sailors! ⚓

We have been working hard since the launch of the game to provide as many bug fixes as we can. We are pleased to announce that our first patch is now live! Thanks to everyone that helped us identify and fix the bugs.

Patch logs:

Multiplayer:
Fixes:
 - Random players will no longer join private games
 - Gramophone will no longer play many songs at once
 - Vinyl records will no longer disappear for clients
 - Music from antenna will always turn off when leaving the radio room
 - Torpedoes are now synced for later joiners
 - Issues related to FTM pins for clients with bad connection
 - Doors no longer can become stuck
 - Player names now will be correct 
 - Clone wars are over - players will be assigned random avatar upon first game launch 
Adjustments:
 - Server codes are now 5 digits long
 - Solved the problem of griefing with a bomb, now only the host can open the cabinet with the bomb
 - Players joining multiplayer first time will have random avatars

Gameplay: 
Fixes:
- Issues related to blocked progression in the campaign in the second mission
- Compass readings on the player's watch now will be correct
- Removed slippage after releasing the hydrophone valve
- Welder is now working
- Torpedo counter now shows how many torpedoes are already loaded into front and rear torpedoes loading systems
Adjustments:
- Position of hammer in player's hand 
- Cables in the electric engine are now more visible
- Resources consumption of the bilge pump
- Increased the range from which you can interact with the hydrophone
- Moved the hide button of the observation periscope in the control room to a more visible place
- Unified color of the ladder in conning tower according to the scheme used in the whole game
Improvements:
- Rat behavior and the rat trap
- Radio rooms sliders are now easier to adjust
- Operation of NPC in the rear torpedo room

Combat & other
Fixes:
- Tonnage achievements will now work correctly
- Seabed will no longer be visible in periscopes 
- Game settings and player avatars will now persist throughout game launches 

Adjustments:
- Added more people to game credits
- Removed all morally questionable symbols from the game
- Changed the texture of flags
- Moved the mannequin with the player's avatar in the Avatar Room to a more favorable location
- Minifigures in the Avatar Room can now be picked up
- Visual and sound changes in the main menu
- Improved LOD's of many objects
- Improved numerous collisions inside the sub
- Changed the night aura outside
- Deck cannon is now less accurate 
- Increased accuracy of enemies cannons
- Torpedoes are now overall more accurate
- Depth charges will now explode at maximum of 170 meters
- It's now easier to get away from enemy ships while submerged
